sentences: Normani Kordei Hamilton ( nor-MAH-nee; born May 31, 1996) is an American singer and dancer.
section: N/A

sentences: She auditioned as a solo act for the American television series The X Factor in 2012, after which she became a member of the girl group Fifth Harmony.
section: N/A

sentences: While in Fifth Harmony, Normani competed in Dancing with the Stars (2017) and released her first song outside of the group "Love Lies" (2018), a duet with Khalid, which peaked in the top ten in the US and was certified 5x platinum by RIAA.

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Normani Kordei Hamilton was born on May 31, 1996, in Atlanta, Georgia to Derrick and Andrea Hamilton.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She has two older half sisters, Ashlee and Arielle.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Raised in New Orleans, she and her family relocated to Pearland, Texas, after Hurricane Katrina in 2005.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Normani attended private school as a child, and was homeschooled since sixth grade.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: From the age of three she competed in dance, gymnastics, and beauty pageants.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She and her mother traveled between Houston and Los Angeles for acting, singing and dance auditions.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She recorded a couple of songs, her first at age 13, and appeared in the HBO series Treme.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Normani has said that dancing was her "first passion".
section: == Early life ==

sentences: That marked the end of Normani's X Factor participation as a solo artist.

sentences: However, she was brought back to the show and put into a group with four other girls, Ally Brooke, Lauren Jauregui, Dinah Jane, and Camila Cabello, who would later become Fifth Harmony.

sentences: At the end of the show's season, the group managed to make it to the finale and finished in third place.

sentences: In October 2013, Fifth Harmony released their first EP, Better Together.

sentences: The group released their debut album, Reflection, in 2015, and their second album, 7/27, in 2016.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2018: The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: The latter two albums spawned the hit singles "Worth It" and "Work from Home", respectively.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2018: The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: After Cabello's departure from the group in December 2016, Fifth Harmony released their self-titled album as a quartet in August 2017.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2018: The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: Normani became the quartet's de facto leader, leading solos and choreography.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2018: The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: Her onstage confidence in the group caught the attention of executive Tunji Balogun, who founded RCA's imprint Keep Cool, and manager Brandon Silverstein, who began working with Normani in late 2017.

== Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In 2015, Normani released two dance videos performing Future's "Fuck Up Some Commas" and Teyana Taylor's "Do Not Disturb" on her YouTube channel.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: From February 2016 through January 2017, Normani released covers of several songs, including Tory Lanez's "Say It" and mashups of Drake's "Fake Love"/"Sneakin'", and Solange's "Cranes in the Sky"/"Don't Touch My Hair", with the help of the producers The Invaders.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Normani competed on season 24 of Dancing with the Stars from March through May 2017, alongside her dancing partner, professional ballroom dancer Valentin Chmerkovskiy.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: They reached the finals and finished in third place.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In early August 2017, Normani had a cameo in singer Khalid's music video for "Young Dumb & Broke".
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In October 2017, it was announced that Normani had signed to management company S10 Entertainment as a solo artist.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: She was reported to have signed a publishing deal to Stellar Songs in early February 2018.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Normani's duet with Khalid, "Love Lies" from the soundtrack for romantic teen comedy-drama film Love, Simon (2018), was released in February 2018.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: The song was considered a sleeper hit, peaking at number nine after charting for 28 weeks.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: "Love Lies" scored the highest first-week position for a single by a girl group member in the US, debuting at number 43 on the Billboard Hot 100.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: "Love Lies" charted the Mainstream Top 40 charts for forty five weeks, tying the record for longest charting song on the chart with Dua Lipa's "New Rules".
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In April 2018, following Fifth Harmony's indefinite hiatus, it was announced that Normani had signed to Keep Cool/RCA Records for her debut solo album.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: The following month, it was reported that Normani signed to a modeling contract with Wilhelmina.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Over the next few months, Billboard announced that Normani was collaborating with Calvin Harris and Kehlani.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In August 2018, Normani was featured alongside Kehlani on Jessie Reyez's remix for her song "Body Count", which was featured on Reyez's EP, Being Human in Public.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: She also featured alongside Davido on Quavo's song "Swing", from his debut solo album Quavo Huncho (2018).
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: That month, Normani signed on to a Puma campaign to endorse the brand's RS-0 shoes.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: On October 22, 2018, Normani and Calvin Harris released their EP, Normani x Calvin Harris, which features the songs "Checklist" with Wizkid and "Slow Down".
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: The following day, she performed the two songs alongside a new song, "Waves" featuring 6lack, at the Tidal X Brooklyn concert.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: She then released "Waves" and premiered it on the music radio station Beats 1 on November 15, 2018.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Normani was named the Top Female Breakout Artist of 2018 by Spotify.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In her interview with Beats 1, Normani said that her debut album would be released in the first quarter of 2019, and its title is a number.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: On January 11, 2019, Normani and Sam Smith released the song "Dancing with a Stranger", peaking at number three in the UK and number seven in the U.S. One year into her solo career, Normani became the fastest solo artist (without an album) to surpass one billion combined streams on Spotify.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: In March 2019, she was the supporting act for Ariana Grande's first leg of the Sweetener World Tour in North America.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Normani's single "Motivation", co-written by Grande, was released in August 2019, her first single without a featured artist.

sentences: The song peaked at number 33 in the US.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: "Motivation" was nominated for a Soul Train Music Award for Best Dance Performance.

sentences: In September 2019, Normani performed a dance sequence on the Savage X Fenty runway show for Rihanna's lingerie brand, Savage X Fenty, which premiered on Amazon Prime Video.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Normani then announced that her debut album would be released in 2020, stating "it is a little more than halfway" complete.

section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

sentences: Normani was named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 list for 2020.

section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Solo projects and upcoming debut album ===

== Influences ==

sentences: Influences ==
section: == Influences ==

sentences: Normani has cited 1990s and 2000s R&B and pop, Aaliyah, TLC, En Vogue, Toni Braxton, Selena, Jhené Aiko, Destiny's Child, Mariah Carey, Janet Jackson, Beyoncé, Ciara, Lauryn Hill, and Britney Spears as influences.

== Philanthropy ==

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Along with Fifth Harmony, Normani was involved with the charities Girl Scouts of the US and the Ryan Seacrest Foundation.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In September 2016, Normani was named the Diversity Ambassador for The Cybersmile Foundation, a non-profit organization providing support for victims of cyber bullying and online hate campaigns, after being racially abused online.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In January 2017, Normani signed on to be the celebrity ambassador for the annual Stars & Strikes Celebrity Bowling Event & Tournament hosted by the Los Angeles charity A Place Called Home.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In February 2017, it was announced that Normani partnered with American Cancer Society as a global ambassador to help increase awareness about the importance of breast cancer screening and HPV vaccination.
section: == Philanthropy ==
